message.content:
Here's a simple JavaScript program that generates and prints out the ASCII characters and their corresponding hexadecimal codes for characters in the range of 0 to 127 (as 7F is not commonly used in text):

```javascript
for (let i = 32; i <= 127; i++) {
    let asciiChar = String.fromCharCode(i);
    let hexCode = i.toString(16).toUpperCase();
    console.log(`ASCII: ${asciiChar} | Hex Code: ${hexCode}`);
}
```

This program uses a `for` loop to iterate through the ASCII range from 32 (space character) to 127, as these are the commonly used characters. The `String.fromCharCode(i)` function converts the ASCII code to its corresponding character, and the `toString(16).toUpperCase()` method converts the integer value to a hexadecimal string representation.

To run this program, you can either include it in an HTML file within `<script>` tags or save it as a .js file and run it using Node.js with the following command:

```bash
node your_script_name.js
```

This will output the ASCII characters along with their hexadecimal codes, like this:

```
ASCII: ! | Hex Code: 21
ASCII: " | Hex Code: 22
...
ASCII: ~ | Hex Code: 7E
```
